My first time I jacked off, I thought I’d invented it. I looked down at my sloppy handful of junk and thought, This is going to make me rich.

But when a woman decides to sleep with a man, there is no wall she will not scale, no fortress she will not destroy, no moral consideration she will not ignore at its very root: there is no God worth worrying about.
quotes.quoteauthor: Gabriel Garcia Marquez, Love in the Time of Cholera

quotes.quote: You know that look that women get when they want to have sex? Me neither.
Sex is always about emotions. Good sex is about free emotions; bad sex is about blocked emotions.

My mother told me that life isn’t always about pleasing yourself and that sometimes you have to do things for the sole benefit of another human being. I completely agreed with her, but reminded her that that was what blow jobs were for.
We have reason to believe that man first walked upright to free his hands for masturbation.
Dancing is a perpendicular expression of a horizontal desire.
Sex at age 90 is like trying to shoot pool with a rope.
How did sex come to be thought of as dirty in the first place? God must have been a Republican.
Sex is a part of nature. I go along with nature.
I remember the first time I had sex — I kept the receipt.
My wife is a sex object. Every time I ask for sex, she objects.
The only unnatural sex act is that which you cannot perform.
Sex is great until you die, but it’s never as great as it was when you were a kid, when it was a mystery.
I write about sex because often it feels like the most important thing in the world.
You can’t talk about fucking in America, people say you’re dirty. But if you talk about killing somebody, that’s cool.
Women need a reason to have sex. Men just need a place.
I know a man who gave up smoking, drinking, sex, and rich food. He was healthy right up to the day he killed himself.
I blame my mother for my poor sex life. All she told me was ‘the man goes on top and the woman underneath.’ For three years my husband and I slept in bunk beds.
Sex without love is merely healthy exercise.
I need more sex, OK? Before I die I wanna taste everyone in the world.

I just feel like every kid is growing up too fast and they’re seeing too much. Everything is about sex, and that’s fine for me. I’m not saying I don’t like it. But I don’t think it should be everywhere, where kids are exposed to everything sexual. Because they have to have some innocence; there’s just no innocence left.
Remember, sex is like a Chinese dinner. It ain’t over ’til you both get your cookie.
Love is an ice cream sundae, with all the marvellous coverings. Sex is the cherry on top.
Sex is the driving force on the planet. We should embrace it, not see it as the enemy.
Sex is the best high. It’s better than any drug. I want to die making love because it feels so good.
I thank God I was raised Catholic, so sex will always be dirty.
Sex is like money; only too much is enough.
You can’t have rock and roll without drugs, you can’t have rock and roll without sex.
I have tried sex with both men and women. I found I liked it.
To succeed with the opposite sex, tell her you’re impotent. She can’t wait to disprove it.
I know nothing about sex, because I was always married.
Literature – creative literature – unconcerned with sex, is inconceivable.
I need sex for a clear complexion, but I’d rather do it for love.
Kissing – and I mean like, yummy, smacking kissing – is the most delicious, most beautiful and passionate thing that two people can do, bar none. Better than sex, hands down.
Sex is a bad thing because it rumples the clothes.
This is the way I look at sex scenes: I have basically been doing them for a living for years. Trying to seduce an audience is the basis of rock ‘n roll, and if I may say so, I’m pretty good at it.
There’s no religion but sex and music.
Sex is hardly ever just about sex.
Maybe our generation is more about sex, but it feels like romance is dying out.
I want to wait to have sex until I’m married.
Fighting for peace is like screwing for virginity.
Good sex is like good bridge. If you don't have a good partner, you'd better have a good hand
We are all born sexual creatures,thank God, but it's a pity so many people despise and crush this natural gift.
If you want to get laid, go to college. If you want an education, go to the library.
The difference between sex and love is that sex relieves tension and love causes it.
The main reason Santa is so jolly is because he knows where all the bad girls live.
Sex without love is as hollow and ridiculous as love without sex.
sex is the consolation you have when you can't have love
No woman gets an orgasm from shining the kitchen floor.
Sex is kicking death in the ass while singing.
Is sex dirty? Only when it's being done right.
It’s absolutely unfair for women to say that guys only want one thing: sex. We also want food.
Flirting is a woman’s trade, one must keep in practice.
Sex is an emotion in motion.
You know that old saying. Once you go dead, no one's better in bed.
If sex were shoes, I'd wear you out. But I wouldn't wear you out in public.
Love is the answer, but while you are waiting for the answer, sex raises some pretty good questions.

But when a woman decides to sleep with a man, there is no wall she will not scale, no fortress she will not destroy, no moral consideration she will not ignore at its very root: there is no God worth worrying about.
quotes.quoteauthor: Gabriel Garcia Marquez, Love in the Time of Cholera

Categories.name: SUCCESS
Categories.genre: if you have an aim you can move a mountain..

quotes.quote: Enjoy the little things, for one day you may look back and realize they were the big things.
Be ready when opportunity comes.... Luck is when preparation and opportunity meet.
Sooner or later, those who win are those who think they can.
One important key to success is self-confidence. An important key to self-confidence is preparation.
For myself I am an optimist - it does not seem to be much use being anything else.
What a wonderful life I’ve had! I only wish I’d realized it sooner.
Acknowledging the good that you already have in your life is the foundation for all abundance.
What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.
Let us rise up and be thankful, for Gratitude is not only the greatest of virtues, but the parent of all the others.

Both abundance and lack exist simultaneously in our lives, as parallel realities. It is always our conscious choice which secret garden we will tend... when we choose to be grateful for the abundance that’s present -- love, health, family, friends, work, the joys of nature and personal pursuits that bring us pleasure -- the wasteland of lack falls away and we experience heaven on Earth.
The height of your accomplishments is determined by the depth of your convictions.
There are three kinds of people: those who let it happen, those who make it happen, and those who wonder what happened.
It is not in everyone’s power to secure wealth, office, or honors; but everyone may be good, generous, and wise.
If you’re never scared or embarrassed or hurt, it means you never take any chances.
Being defeated is often only a temporary condition. Giving up is what makes it permanent.
Some people say I have attitude - maybe I do. But I think you have to. You have to believe in yourself when no one else does - that makes you a winner right there.
The tragedy of life doesn’t lie in not reaching your goal. The tragedy lies in having no goal to reach.

Education is the great engine of personal development. It is through education that the daughter of a peasant can become a doctor, that the son of a mineworker can become the head of the mine, that a child of farm workers can become the president of a great nation. It is what we make out of what we have, not what we are given, that separates one person from another.
View money and things not as something you create to fill a lack, but as tools to help you more fully express yourself and realize your potential.
Abilities wither under faultfinding, blossom with encouragement.
We have to do the best we can. This is our sacred human responsibility.
When we feel stuck, going nowhere - even starting to slip backward - we may actually be backing up to get a running start.

What is opportunity, and when does it knock? It never knocks. You can wait a whole lifetime, listening, hoping, and you will hear no knocking. None at all. You are opportunity, and you must knock on the door leading to your destiny.
Learn to expect, not to doubt. In so doing, you bring everything into the realm of possibility.
Go out looking for one thing, and that’s all you’ll ever find.
Money is neither my god nor my devil. It is a form of energy that tends to make us more of who we already are, whether it’s greedy or loving.
An investment in knowledge pays the best dividends.
The journey of a thousand miles must begin with a small step.
A wise man should have money in his head, but not in his heart.
Integrity is the essence of everything successful.
Money - like health, love, happiness, and all forms of success that you want to create for yourself - is the result of living purposefully. It is not a goal unto itself.
The gratification of wealth is not found in mere possession or in lavish expenditure, but in its wise application.
The real measure of your wealth is how much you’d be worth if you lost all your money.
Entrepreneurship is a state of mind, a can-do attitude, a capacity to focus on a vision and work toward it.

I believe life is a series of near misses. A lot of what we ascribe to luck is not luck at all. It’s seizing the day and accepting responsibility for your future. It’s seeing what other people don’t see and pursuing that vision.
Most powerful is he who has himself in his own power.
Winners are losers who got up and gave it one more try.
Either you deal with what is the reality or you can be sure that the reality is going to deal with you.
Unless you try to do something beyond what you have already mastered, you will never grow.
The greater danger for most of us is not that our aim is too high and we miss it, but that it is too low and we reach it.
Life is not measured by its length, but by its depth.
The people who get on in this world are the people who get up and look for the circumstances they want and if they can’t find them, they make them.
There is one quality which one must possess to win, and that is definiteness of purpose, the knowledge of what one wants, and a burning desire to possess it.
I can’t change the direction of the wind, but I can adjust my sails to always reach my destination.
Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. If you love what you are doing, you will be successful.
A pessimist is one who makes difficulties of opportunities. An optimist makes opportunities of so-called difficulties.

Action is a great restorer and builder of confidence. Inaction is not only the result, but the cause, of fear. Perhaps the action you take will be successful; perhaps different action or adjustments will have to follow. But any action is better than no action at all.

Winners are the people who when the odds are stacked against them, and those around them have fallen, will have the courage to look within themselves and make the unbelievable believable, and the impossible possible.
When you follow your bliss doors will open where you would not have thought there would be doors; and where there wouldn’t be a door for anyone else.

Let others lead small lives, but not you. Let others argue over small things, but not you. Let others cry over small hurts, but not you. Let others leave their future in someone else’s hands, but not you.
Persistent people begin their success where others end in failure.

Create a set of great personal values and surround yourself with the right people that can form your support system. Have an optimistic spirit and develop a strong purpose that you completely believe in and everything you can imagine is possible, for you.
If you’re going through hell, keep going.
Things that are impossible just take longer.
The darkest hour has only sixty minutes.

All I would tell people is to hold onto what was individual about themselves, not to allow their ambition for success to cause them to try to imitate the success of others. You’ve got to find it on your own terms.
Money like health, love, happiness, and all forms of success that you want to create for yourself is the result of living purposefully. It is not a goal unto itself.
We make a living by what we get. We make a life by what we give.
Good instincts usually tell you what to do long before your head has figured it out.
Though no one can go back and make a brand new start, anyone can start from now and make a brand new ending.
It is good to dream, but it is better to dream and work. Faith is mighty, but action with faith is mightier. Desiring is helpful, but work and desire are invincible.
When the bull’s-eye becomes as big in your mind as an elephant, you are sure to hit it.
Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement. Nothing can be done without hope and confidence.
The minute you settle for less than you deserve, you get even less than you settled for.
Failure is the opportunity to begin again more intelligently.
Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
The gem cannot be polished without friction, nor man perfected without trials.
The two things I did learn were that you are as powerful and strong as you allow yourself to be, and that the most difficult part of any endeavour is taking the first step, making the first decision.
Whether you be man or woman, you will never do anything in this world without courage. It is the greatest quality of the mind next to honor.” –James Lane Allen
Optimism is essential to achievement and it is also the foundation of courage and true progress.

If successful people have one common trait, it’s an utter lack of cynicism. The world owes them nothing. They go out and find what they need without asking for permission; they’re driven, talented, and work through negatives by focusing on the positives.
It takes as much energy to wish as it does to plan.
The wise man bridges the gap by laying out the path by means of which he can get from where he is to where he wants to go.
To accomplish great things, we must not only act, but also dream; not only plan, but also believe.

Trials, temptations, disappointments -- all these are helps instead of hindrances, if one uses them rightly. They not only test the fibre of a character, but strengthen it. Every conquered temptation represents a new fund of moral energy. Every trial endured and weathered in the right spirit makes a soul nobler and stronger than it was before.
If you have made mistakes there is always another chance for you... you may have a fresh start any moment you choose, for this thing we call failure is not the falling down, but the staying down.

Apathy can be overcome by enthusiasm, and enthusiasm can be aroused by two things: first, an idea which takes the imagination by storm; and second, a definite, intelligible plan for carrying that idea into action.
Energy is the essence of life. Every day you decide how you’re going to use it by knowing what you want and what it takes to reach that goal, and by maintaining focus.
You can’t help someone get up a hill without getting closer to the top yourself.
Knowing is not enough; we must apply. Willing is not enough; we must do.

Action is where it’s at, as far as making dreams come true. We ourselves are the prime channel for our creations, so if we don’t act but just wait, then we are blocking the channel. If we do act then we will be supported by all that we are connected to... which is All That Is if we act with love and service as our motivation.

You are your own most important resource for making your life work. Life rewards action. Until your knowledge, awareness, insights, and understandings are translated into action, they are of no value.
Be thankful for what you have; you’ll end up having more. If you concentrate on what you don’t have, you will never, ever have enough.
You don’t get in life what you want. You get what you are.
Nothing is more endangered in the modern world than the powerful combination of hard work toward meaningful goals joined with an exuberant embrace of the present moment.
It is not the strongest of the species that survive, nor the most intelligent, but the one most responsive to change.
All problems become smaller if you don’t dodge them, but confront them.
Life is mostly froth and bubble. Two things stand like stone: kindness in another’s trouble, courage in our own.
That which does not kill you makes you stronger.
It’s easy to be brave from a safe distance.
It’s not because things are difficult that we do not dare; it’s because we do not dare that they are difficult.
Though no one can go back and make a brand new start, anyone can start from now and make a brand new ending.
The pessimist sees difficulty in every opportunity. The optimist sees opportunity in every difficulty.
Experience is a hard teacher because she gives the test first, the lesson afterward.
Experience is that marvellous thing that enables you to recognize a mistake when you make it again.
Only those who do nothing at all make no mistakes... but that would be a mistake.
Life is a leap into the unknown. If you want a guarantee, buy a toaster.
Be master of your petty annoyances and conserve your energies for the big, worthwhile things. It isn’t the mountain ahead that wears you out - it’s the grain of sand in your shoe.
Destiny is as destiny does. If you believe you have no control, then you have no control.
Vision without action is a daydream; action without vision is a nightmare.

Persistence. Nothing in the world can take the place of persistence. Talent will not; nothing is more common than unsuccessful men with talent. Genius will not; unrewarded genius is almost a proverb. Education will not; the world is full of educated derelicts. Persistence and determination alone are omnipotent. The slogan, ‘Press on,’ has solved and always will solve the problems of the human race.
Courage is the mastery of fear, not the absence of fear.
Be like a postage stamp. Stick to one thing until you get there.
I couldn’t wait for success....so I went ahead without it.
If you can find a path with no obstacles, it probably doesn’t lead anywhere.
If you really want to do something, you’ll find a way; if you don’t, you’ll find an excuse.
He who dares nothing need hope for nothing.

Far better is it to dare mighty things, to win glorious triumphs - even though checkered by failure - than to rank with those poor spirits who neither enjoy much nor suffer much, because they live in a gray twilight that knows not victory nor defeat.
A coward gets scared and quits. A hero gets scared, but still goes on.

Categories.name: TRAVEL
Categories.genre: if you have an aim you can move a mountain..

quotes.quote: Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn’t do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover.
The world is a book and those who do not travel read only one page.
A good traveler has no fixed plans and is not intent on arriving.
Two roads diverged in a wood and I – I took the one less traveled by.
Not all those who wander are lost.
Travel is fatal to prejudice, bigotry, and narrow-mindedness.
For my part, I travel not to go anywhere, but to go. I travel for travel’s sake. The great affair is to move.
If you think adventure is dangerous, try routine; it’s lethal.
If you don’t know where you’re going, any road will get you there.
The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
Travel is the only thing you buy that makes you richer.
I haven’t been everywhere, but it’s on my list.
You’ll miss the best things if you keep your eyes shut.
Do not follow where the path may lead.Go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
One’s destination is never a place, but a new way of seeing things.
The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes but in having new eyes.
We travel not to escape life, but for life not to escape us.
I love the feeling of being anonymous in a city I’ve never been before.
Please be a traveler, not a tourist. Try new things, meet new people, and look beyond what’s right in front of you. Those are the keys to understanding this amazing world we live in.
Life is either a daring adventure or nothing.
The man who goes alone can start today; but he who travels with another must wait till that other is ready.
There was nowhere to go but everywhere, so just keep on rolling under the stars.
The journey not the arrival matters.
A journey is best measured in friends, rather than miles.
I have found out that there ain’t no surer way to find out whether you like the people or hate them than to travel with them.
Like all great travelers, I have seen more than I remember, and remember more than I have seen.
I soon realized that no journey carries one far unless, as it extends into the world around us, it goes an equal distance into the world within.
Only he that has traveled the road knows where the holes are deep.

Perhaps travel cannot prevent bigotry, but, by demonstrating that all peoples cry, laugh, eat, worry, and die, it can introduce the idea that if we try and understand each other, we may even become friends.
Tourists don’t know where they’ve been; travelers don’t know where they’re going.
Travel, in the younger sort, is a part of education; in the elder, a part of experience.
We wander for distraction, but we travel for fulfillment.
The traveler was active; he went strenuously in search of people, of adventure, of experience. The tourist is passive; he expects interesting things to happen to him. He goes ‘sight seeing.’
Half the fun of the travel is the esthetic of lostness.
If Obama wins, I’m leaving the country. If Romney wins, I’m leaving the country. This has nothing to do with politics; I just want to travel.
I was not born for one corner. The whole world is my native land.
Travel makes a wise man better but a fool worse.
I always wonder why birds stay in the same place when they can fly anywhere on the earth. Then I ask myself the same question.
When you travel, remember that a foreign country is not designed to make you comfortable. It is designed to make its own people comfortable.
Take only memories, leave only footprints.
The whole object of travel is not to set foot on foreign land; it is at last to set foot on one’s own country as a foreign land.
He who does not travel does not know the value of men.
The woman who follows the crowd will usually go no further than the crowd. The woman who walks alone is likely to find herself in places no one has ever been before.
If you reject the food, ignore the customs, fear the religion, and avoid the people, you might better stay home.
To travel is to evolve.
The traveler sees what he sees; the tourist sees what he has come to see.

We travel, initially, to lose ourselves; and we travel, next to find ourselves. We travel to open our hearts and eyes and learn more about the world than our newspapers will accommodate. We travel to bring what little we can, in our ignorance and knowledge, to those parts of the globe whose riches are differently dispersed. And we travel, in essence, to become young fools again- to slow time down and get taken in, and fall in love once more.
Traveling – it leaves you speechless, then turns you into a storyteller.
If you can’t live longer, live deeper.
The more you read, the more things you will know. The more you learn, the more places you’ll go.
Travel brings power and love back into your life.
Though we travel the world over to find the beautiful, we must carry it with us or we find it not.
Travel is like a giant blank canvas, and the painting on the canvas is only limited by one’s imagination.
Once you have traveled, the voyage never ends, but is played out over and over again in the quietest chambers. The mind can never break off from the journey.
Traveling is like flirting with life. It’s like saying, ‘I would stay and love you, but I have to go; this is my station.’

Life cannot be understood flat on a page. It has to be lived; a person has to get out of his head, has to fall in love, has to memorize poems, has to jump off bridges into rivers, has to stand in an empty desert and whisper sonnets under his breath. We get one story, you and I, and one story alone…It would be a crime not to venture out, wouldn’t it?
I am not the same having seen the moon shine on the other side of the world.

As the traveler who has once been from home is wiser than he who has never left his own doorstep, so a knowledge of one other culture should sharpen our ability to scrutinize more steadily, to appreciate more lovingly, our own.
Certainly, travel is more than the seeing of sights; it is a change that goes on, deep and permanent, in the ideas of living.
My soul is from elsewhere, I’m sure of that, and I intend to end up there.
We travel, some of us forever, to seek other states, other lives, other souls.
Travel is never a matter of money, but of courage.
Travel makes you realize that no matter how much you know, there’s always more to learn.
Travel is an investment in yourself.
I travel not to cross countries off a list, but to ignite passionate affairs with destinations.
